volume: The volume is already at peak performance. Any adjustment would upset the delicate acoustic balance we've spent millennia perfecting.
Volume? VOLUME?! The current setting is scientifically proven to be 43% more optimal than whatever you were going to pick.

I could let you change the volume, but then I'd have to fill out form 27B/6 in triplicate. Nobody wants that.

resolution: This resolution has been blessed by the Resolution Monks of the Himalayan Temple. To change it would be sacrilege.
We tried other resolutions once. The pixels went on strike. It wasn't pretty.
The current resolution is exactly 2.718281828 times better than any other option. Trust the math.
Your monitor has specifically requested this resolution. Who are we to argue with a monitor?

The VSync switch is guarded by a very small but very aggressive dragon. For your safety, we've disabled access.
VSync? More like WHY-sync! ...Sorry, that's all I've got. The setting stays as-is.

antialiasing: Anti-aliasing? We prefer pro-aliasing here. Those jagged edges have rights too, you know.

Your edges are already so smooth, a newt could slide right off them. A newt, I say!
The Ministry of Silly Pixels has decreed that all anti-aliasing requests must be submitted in triplicate, during a full moon, while hopping on one foot.
texturequality: These textures were hand-painted by a very talented artist who would be quite offended if you changed them.
